programme.desc: The Bulldogs (7-6) and Bears (8-5) kick off their conference schedules with this contest. This is a rematch of last year's Ivy League Tournament final, which Yale won 62-61 over Brown on a Matt Knowling buzzer-beater. Knowling now plays for USC.

programme.title: Live: College Basketball
programme.desc: A battle of the Owls in American Athletic Conference play sees Rice (11-5, 2-1) host Temple (9-6, 1-1). Temple owns a 4-1 edge over Rice after the teams split two contests last season. Rice is 6-1 at home this season, while Temple is 1-3 on the road.

programme.title: Live: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Cardinal try to string together ACC wins when they host the Cavaliers. Stanford snapped a three-game skid Jan. 8 by beating another Old Dominion State program, Virginia Tech, 70-59. Elijah Saunders paces Virginia with 12.1 points per game.

programme.title: Live: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Golden Hurricane (7-9, 1-2 American) tip off against the 49ers (7-9, 0-3). Tulsa snapped a three-game series slide against Charlotte with a 69-67 decision in their second meeting of 2023-24. The 49ers try to end a four-game skid in 2024-25.

programme.title: Live: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Flames head to the Pelican State for a Conference USA tilt against the Bulldogs. The teams split a pair of contests during Liberty's first season in the conference in 2023-24. French senior Daniel Batcho (LT) averaged 19.5 points in those games.

programme.title: College Football

programme.desc: The Bison (13-2) battle the Bobcats (15-0) for the FCS Championship. North Dakota State beat South Dakota State 28-21 for the Dakota Marker in the semifinals, while Montana State topped South Dakota 31-17. ND State seeks a record 10th national title.

programme.sub-title: Minnesota Wild at Vegas Golden Knights
programme.desc: The Golden Knights try to make it four straight over the Wild. Vegas leads the series 17-16 after defeating Minnesota 3-2 earlier this season for its sixth victory in the last seven meetings. Ilya Samsonov (VGK) turned aside 20 shots in that game.
